subject: RE: [junit] Re: No summary output after running several testSuites
msgSnippet: Hi, Diego.  From your description, it sounds to me like the issue is related to NetBeans JUnit test runner.  I ve never used NetBeans, so I don t have any
messageBody:
Hi, Diego. From your description, it sounds to me like the issue is
related to NetBeans' JUnit test runner. I've never used NetBeans, so I
don't have any specific advice. Can you try running your tests from
ant, using <junit> and <junit report>? If that gives the test results
you're expecting then, that would tell us that it's a NetBeans thing.
Everything you wrote in your email looks fine to me


Todd.


> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of diego_pino_garcia
> Sent: Thursday, October 04, 2007 2:13 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Re: No summary output after running several
> testSuites
>
> Hi Todd,
>
> I am running Junit through NetBeans 5.5.1
>
> I am using junit-3.8.1
>
> I organized my tests in several TestSuites. Every TestSuite inherites
> from a more general class called BaseProba, likewise
> BaseProba extends
> AbstractTransactionalDataSourceSpringContextTests
>
> Then later there is general a class called MainTest (extends
> TestCase) that actually runs the tests. For instance,
>
> public static Test suite() {
> TestSuite ret = new TestSuite();
>
> ret.addTestSuite(myTest1.class);
> ret.addTestSuite(myTest2.class);
>
> return ret;
> }
>
> About the tests, tests interact with a DBMS through Hibernate.
> Hibernate dialect is HSSQL (HyperSonic SQL, a DBMS which
> stores its data straight in memory). In addition, we also use
> Spring to set some beans which are used by the test classes.
>
> Basically, this is my environment. If you need further
> information I do not mind giving you more detail.
>
> Thanks is advance
>
> Diego
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Bradley, Todd"
> <todd.bradley@...> wrote:
> >
> > Which version of JUnit are you using? How do you run your tests?

> > > Hi all,
> > >
> > > I wrote a pile of tests for my current project. Tests are
> running OK
> > > when I run each of them individually. Every time I run a
> testSuite I
> > > got a summary report about what methods failed and which
> passed. I
> > > think this is Junit's expected behaviour.
> > >
> > > The point is that when I try to run my testSuites
> alltogether at a
> > > time, I got no summary (just a line telling me the most general
> > > test, the one which launches the other testSuites,
> passed). It seems
> > > that Junit stops quietly, so I am afraid it may fail.
> > >
> > > On the other hand, I forced some of the tests to fail, then I got
> > > some summary output but only for those methods which failed.
> > >
> > > I do know whether this is related to my code or is it an
> issue from
> > > Junit. I would be glad if anybody familiar with this
> could shed some
> > > light...
> > >
> > > Thanks in advance
